page.title: 08EDUCATION IN THE BRAES
page.content: At one time there was a school for all the children in the district close to the Catholic Church. With the fall in the number of chldren in the area, it was decided to close the school and transfer all the pupils to Tomintoul. A bus load of youngsters now leave the Braes at 8.15am daily, returning at 4.30pm, thus providing the only public transport. Tomintoul has a Primary department with three teachers for the different age groups, and a Secondary department which covers all subjects but only until the child is 16. If the child wishes to study for highers he must transfer to Aberlour. There are Colleges of Further Education at Elgin or Inverness as well as Aberdeen which also sports a University.
